importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners in the ALCS, forcing a Game 7, which is significant as it marks the culmination of a pivotal playoff series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The six-day window between Game 2 and Game 7 highlights a turning point in the Mariners' playoff performance, especially with Yesavage's strong pitching performance after a previous collapse.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and helping force a decisive Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners committed three season-high errors, including two in the second inning, which allowed Toronto to score early and build a 4-0 lead.
Addison Barger and Isiah Kiner-Falefa scored early with back-to-back RBI singles, and Barger later hit a two-run homer to expand the lead.
Josh Naylor homered in the sixth inning to give the Mariners a run, but the lead was not enough after a wild pitch in the seventh allowed Guerrero Jr. to score.
Randy Yesavage delivered a strong pitching performance, throwing 31 splitters and allowing only six hits and three walks, showcasing composure and control.
The Blue Jays have played a Game 7 in the ALCS for the first time since 1985, marking a significant milestone in their recent playoff history.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
The Mariners will play their first Game 7 in franchise history, highlighting the intensity and significance of this series.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason as the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners committed three critical errors, including two in the second inning, leading to early runs. Despite Josh Naylor's homer and a single by Eugenio Suárez, the Blue Jays' strong pitching and hitting, including a two-run homer by Addison Barger and a solo shot by Guerrero Jr., secured the win. The Blue Jays have now played a Game 7 since 1985, while the Mariners play their first Game 7 in franchise history. The winner of the series will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
